sentences.sContent: In the recession, the company’s profits plunged 60%.
sentences.sCn: 萧条时期，那家公司的利润骤跌了60%。

phrases.pCn: 投入；跳入；突然或仓促地开始某事
冒险尝试；采取决定性步骤

remMethod.val: “扑浪急” → 掉入海里， 着急地扑打着浪花 → 掉入

words.tran: [机] 活塞；潜水者；跳水者；莽撞的人

trans.tranOther: if a price, rate etc plunges, it suddenly decreases by a large amount

trans.tranOther: a sudden large decrease in the price, value etc of something
